post_text: Teacher Drive In! Come drive through to meet your 20-21 Noble teachers and staff!
text: Teacher Drive In! Come drive through to meet your 20-21 Noble teachers and staff!

Euclid Recreation
August 24 at 1:10 PM ·

post_text:
Hello Noble Families,

As we prepare for this unconventional beginning of our 2020 - 2021 school year, we would love to invite you to our Meet the Teacher Drive Thru Event!

Event is for all scholars and families (K-8) and will take place Tuesday, August 25th from 3pm-5pm. Parents will enter our Parent Drop Off Lot off of St. Clair (there will be no entry off of 200th Street).

Teachers will be lining the lot with signs eager to meet new scholars and see old scholars! Families are encouraged -but not required- to decorate their cars or create signs with the names and grades of their scholars.

All scholars and families will remain inside their vehicles as they drive through. The building will not be accessible to families and scholars at this event.

Please contact Ms.Tate or Mrs.Tondola (Ms.Groh) with any questions (tate@noblecleveland.org or tondola@noblecleveland.org)

#weareconcept #nobleknightscle

post_text:
We have a very important announcement regarding Noble Academy’s plans for the start of the school year. On July 30, the Cuyahoga County Board of Health recommended that schools return remotely for the Fall, citing increasing cases and COVID-19 positivity rates here in our county. Euclid City Schools made an announcement on July 31st that their district would be fully remote for the first quarter, likewise, Noble Academy will alter the plans and have our scholars learn at-home in a virtual environment for at least the first marking period which ends on October 30th.

All families, even those who did not sign up for the 100% virtual learning, will now participate in online learning for at least…

post_text:
Noble Academy Cleveland would like to thank the Euclid Police Department in making our 8th grade Drive-in and Mobile Procession Graduation Ceremony a huge success. NAC sends a huge thank you to Officer Mausar and Officer Rodgriguez for making our scholars' celebration truly special. We would also like to thank Kristal Grida Assistant to the Mayor and the Mayor's Office in assisting in making this event a reality for our scholars during these unprecedented times of Covid-19.

We are proud of the Class of 2020!

#WeAreConcept

Attention Noble Families!! Do you know any families looking for a school for their k-8 scholars? Refer a scholar to Noble Academy and get $50 per scholar added to your school account. Money can be used for uniforms, field trips, lunch account, or other various school fees.

Check out the flyer for more information! Email Mrs. Kovach (kovach@noblecleveland.org) or Ms. Wuest (wuest@noblecleveland.org) if you have any questions!

post_text: We are very disappointed to announce that we must delay today’s promotion ceremony. We will use our planned rain date of Monday, June 8. Unfortunately, the weather forecast has changed in the last 12 hours and is predicting not only rain, but thunder and lightning during our planned event time this evening. The predicted forecast for Sunday through Tuesday is sunny with no rain. We look forward to celebrating as planned on Monday, June 8, with 8A at 4pm and 8B at 6pm. All previously shared details and plans will stand. If you have any questions please contact Ms. Tate through email tate@noblecleveland.org.

post_text: Wishing all you hard working moms a very happy (and belated) Mother’s Day! If there’s ever been a time to be appreciative of you strong women, it is NOW! You are working harder than ever to support your own families, teach your scholars, and it does not go unnoticed. You are amazing. We are so lucky to work with such amazing women, We are learning so much from you all! We hope you find enjoyment in your day!

post_text:
The Ohio Department of Education has given families and caregivers some helpful tips on how to support your scholars during this time.

Some highlights:

Talk to Your Child about the Current Situation
- Have age-appropriate conversations with your child and be sure all adults in the household are using the same language to describe what is happening. Be sure you understand the correct facts from medical and government resources.

Limit Exposure
-Be mindful of adult conversations or media coverage about what is happening. Limit your child’s exposure to these as they could cause an increase in anxiety or distress in your child.

Set Expectations
- Set expectations for your child to complete a set amount of academic work daily. This helps with structure but also will help avoid the pressures of feeling behind when he or she returns to school.

Focus on the Positive
- Point out the “helpers” in the world and the good things they are doing. Stay simple and limit detail about anything frightening, but emphasize the good work being done.

Click the link for more information!
shared_text:
EDUCATION.OHIO.GOV
How to Support Your Child’s Health and Well-Being During Ohio’s Ordered School-Building Closure | Ohio Department of Education

post_text:
March 30, 2020

Dear Noble Families,

We hope you have relaxed and enjoyed the scheduled spring break! Staff members are available again Monday-Friday between 9am and 3pm to answer any questions and provide assistance. Work assigned to scholars should last through this week. If your scholar(s) did not receive a work packet in the mail, please contact their teacher. All teachers’ email addresses have been listed on the school website:

www.noblecleveland.org/staff

As we wait for Governor DeWine to make an official announcement, we foresee a decision indicating online learning to begin now through the end of the school year. We will continue communicating any and all updates with you as they occur.

The school building will continue to be closed. Access will be by appointment only through Ms. Wuest. During this time, phone calls regarding school matters should be made to (216) 507-8900.

Thank you again for your support and communication during this time.

Stay well,

Noble Academy

post_text:
Thank you to all who came out for our Black History Month Celebration! And thank you to all our scholars and teachers that put in the effort to making this a great program.

Mrs. McCain and her homeroom scholars started the program off singing "Lift Every Voice and Sing". Our young and older cheerleaders performed for the audience, along with Noble's STEP. Elementary scholars sang songs, while older scholars read poems, speeches, sang, and danced. All showing of their talents!

post_text:
Here's to another successful Cultural Night! Scholars and families had the chance to travel the world. Each classroom picked a country where they spent time learning their culture. Classrooms were decorated with the various cultures. Families got their passport stamped as they visited the different countries. Henna artist and calligraphers even entertained our guests!

Thank you to all who came out.

Today we continued Leader in Me! As a school we are working on 7 Habits:
1. Be Proactive
2. Begin With End In Mind
3. Put First Things First
4. Think Win-Win
5. Seek First To Understand Then To Be Understood
6. Synergize
7. Sharpen The Saw
Each homeroom participates in various activities and discussions.

We'd like to thank them for their gracious donation!

post_text:
This week we started Leader in Me. Classes spent time discussing Habit 1 "Be Proactive". All classes talked about using proactive language such as understanding what is in our inner circle of control.

We are excited to learn about all 7 habits to becoming great leaders!

post_text:
Do you know of anyone looking for a new school? Refer a new scholar to Noble Academy and receive $50 credit that can go towards: uniforms, lunch payments, school supplies, field trips! Students should be referred after August 21st. Check out the flyer for details!

We will also be holding an Open House tonight, 3:30-6:30, for any families interested. Help spread the word!

post_text:
Noble families

It's that wonderful time of the year again!

A few quick reminders as we start the school year.
Kindergarten orientation is held Thursday, August 8th, at 5:30.
New scholars 1st-8th grade orientation is August 12th, 8 am - 12:15 pm. No buses will be provided.
All scholars first day is August 13th. It will be a full day and buses will be provided.

We can't wait to see all our scholars!

post_text:
Tomorrow our scholars are going to begin a school-wide fundraiser called Pennies for Patients to help collect money for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. Homerooms will be competing and prizes will be awarded for the top 3 classrooms. Donations can be sent in with scholars all week and are due by Friday March 15th (the flier was sent home last week of the back of the Noble News). Our goal is to raise over $500!

Watch this video for an introduction: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PluE1SoNmw&t=5s

Want to donate online instead? Use this link: https://events.lls.org/pages/noh/Noble-Academy-Cleveland-2019

We'll also be posting pictures that are from our school choice week celebrations! Our first picture is from our Yellow Day!

post_text: Here are some 5th grade students working on a STEM challenge in their ELA class. They used cups to try and make their best version of a Christmas Tree and then they were given the challenge to make an abstract shape with the same cups. Then they wrote about their challenges and successes and talked about how communication played into it. They had a blast!
text: Here are some 5th grade students working on a STEM challenge in their ELA class. They used cups to try and make their best version of a Christmas Tree and then they were given the challenge to make an abstract shape with the same cups. Then they wrote about their challenges and successes and talked about how communication played into it. They had a blast!

post_text: We enjoyed seeing so many of our families at Cultural Night last week! Our next school event is this Tuesday, October 30th, with Trunk or Treat. Students are permitted to wear an appropriate costume to school or dress down with fall colors. A flyer was on the back of this week's Noble News.

post_text: Do you like Pizza? Maybe you just won't feel like cooking dinner. Well, order some pizza! Noble is partnering with Marco's Pizza for a school fundraiser. Flyers are coming home with students today. Tomorrow, October 16, 2018, you can order a pizza with Marco's and a part of the proceeds will be donated to Noble. See the flyer coming home or the image for directions. Cheese, Pepperoni, Sausage, so many choices!!!

post_text:
Are you proud to be a Noble Knight or a family member of a Noble Knight? Maybe you want to show support for our athletic teams! We have a website for you to check out! Visit this site to choose and customize your own Noble Academy clothing. (some images on the customize page might say Saint Paul, but it comes up as Noble in the design page). Noble Knight clothing purchased from this site will be able to be worn as a part of Spirit wear for students.

https://www.spiritshop.com/school/ohio/euclid/saint-paul-school

post_text: Our first round of Muffins for Moms (for K-4) is tomorrow morning from 9am-10am. We are excited to see you. The second round will be Friday morning (5-8) at the same time. Family members should head to the cafeteria and give their scholar's dismissal number for them to be called down.

post_text: Come support Noble and have fun while doing it! Our first school skating party is this Friday, August 31st from 5:30-8:30 at United Skates. The cost is $2 to get in or $4 if you need to rent skates. We hope to see you there!

post_text: We hope your scholars are enjoying their first week back to school. Noble would like to invite families to attend Open House next Tuesday, August 21st from 5:30-6:30pm.
text: We hope your scholars are enjoying their first week back to school. Noble would like to invite families to attend Open House next Tuesday, August 21st from 5:30-6:30pm.

post_text:
A school reach went out on Wednesday evening; if you didn't receive the phone call, contact the office and update your contact information. Here is some important information for next week:

Monday, August 13th:
-new scholars ONLY. Doors open at 7:55 and scholars are dismissed at 1:00pm. There are no buses
-From 8:30am-11:30am is supply drop-off for Kindergarten students only

Tuesday, August 14th:
-First full day of school for ALL students in grades 1-8

KINDERGARTEN:
Tuesday (14th), Wednesday (15th), Thursday (16th)
-Students have been assigned a specific day for their stagger start entry. These students will only come on their assigned day. The first FULL day for ALL Kindergarten students will be on Friday, August 17th. If you are unsure of your scholar's assigned date, contact our office.

We can't wait to see all of our scholars next week!

We can't wait to see all of our scholars next week!
